text:
Kristen Stewart has been in Manitoba, Canada recently shooting a movie and decided to crash a random wedding in Winnipeg, you know, as you do.

Brides Kirsten and Kayleigh Jennings were going about their wedding day as normal, when the owner of the restaurant that held their reception asked if Stewart and her girlfriend Stella Maxwell could stop by.

Um, what?

That’s right. Around 10 p.m. the restaurant owner asked Kirsten Jennings, one of the brides, if a surprise guest could attend the reception.

"The owner came up to me, and he said, 'Hey, is it okay if Kristen Stewart and her girlfriend Stella [Maxwell] come and have a few drinks with you guys?' and I was like, 'Yeah, totally! Yeah, no problem. Um, who is that?'" the bride told CBC News.

We’re not 100 percent sure WHY Stewart and Maxwell wanted to attend the wedding, but we know that Stewart knew the restaurant owner from a recent event in Winnipeg. Stewart and Maxwell reportedly stayed from 10 p.m. to 1 a.m., you know, as you do.

The DJ even got footage of Stewart dancing with everyone.

The brides were incredibly accommodating, and added that Stewart and Maxwell, “looked just like two normal girls. They look a little Hollywood, but if we didn’t know who they were, I don’t know if I would have known.”

“We said ‘Hey, you know. Come on and meet your guests and, you know, don’t segregate yourselves. Come and party,'” she continued.

So random. We’re wondering if Stewart is acting in or directing a movie about crashing Canadian weddings and stopped by for “research.”

Regardless, party on K. Stew.
title: Kristen Stewart and her GF crashed a wedding, but the bride had no idea who they were
